sn47.20:2.1.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ‘janapadakalyāṇī, janapadakalyāṇī’ti kho, bhikkhave, mahājanakāyo sannipateyya.
sn47.20:2.1.en: “Mendicants, suppose that on hearing, ‘The [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land! The [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land!’ a large crowd would gather.

sn47.20:2.2.pli: ‘Sā kho panassa janapadakalyāṇī paramapāsāvinī nacce, paramapāsāvinī gīte.
sn47.20:2.2.en: And the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land would dance and sing in a most thrilling way.

sn47.20:2.3.pli: Janapadakalyāṇī naccati gāyatī’ti kho, bhikkhave, bhiyyoso mattāya mahājanakāyo sannipateyya.
sn47.20:2.3.en: On hearing, ‘The [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land is dancing and singing! The [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land is dancing and singing!’ an even larger crowd would gather.

sn47.20:2.6.pli: ‘ayaṁ te, ambho purisa, samatittiko telapatto antarena ca mahāsamajjaṁ antarena ca janapadakalyāṇiyā pariharitabbo.
sn47.20:2.6.en: ‘Mister, this is a bowl full to the brim with oil. You must carry it in between this large crowd and the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land.

dn13:19.0.en: 2.1. The Simile of the [38;5;121mFinest Lady[0m in the Land

dn13:19.2.pli: ‘ahaṁ yā imasmiṁ janapade janapadakalyāṇī, taṁ icchāmi, taṁ kāmemī’ti.
dn13:19.2.en: ‘Whoever the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land is, it is her that I want, her that I desire!’

dn13:19.4.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ—
dn13:19.4.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know whether

dn13:19.8.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ—evaṁnāmā evaṅgottāti vā, dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vāti, amukasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā’ti?
dn13:19.8.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know her name or clan? Whether she’s tall or short or medium? Whether her skin is black, brown, or tawny? What village, town, or city she comes from?’

mn80:3.4.pli: ‘ahaṁ yā imasmiṁ janapade janapadakalyāṇī, taṁ icchāmi taṁ kāmemī’ti.
mn80:3.4.en: ‘Whoever the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land is, it is her that I want, her I desire!’

mn80:3.6.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ—khattiyī vā brāhmaṇī vā vessī vā suddī vā’ti?
mn80:3.6.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know whether she’s an aristocrat, a brahmin, a merchant, or a worker?’

mn80:3.9.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ evaṁnāmā evaṅgottāti vāti …pe… dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vāti … amukasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā’ti?
mn80:3.9.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know her name or clan? Whether she’s tall or short or medium? Whether her skin is black, brown, or tawny? What village, town, or city she comes from?’

mn79:10.4.pli: ‘ahaṁ yā imasmiṁ janapade janapadakalyāṇī taṁ icchāmi, taṁ kāmemī’ti.
mn79:10.4.en: ‘Whoever the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land is, it is her that I want, her I desire!’

mn79:10.6.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ—khattiyī vā brāhmaṇī vā vessī vā suddī vā’ti?
mn79:10.6.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know whether she’s an aristocrat, a brahmin, a merchant, or a worker?’

mn79:10.9.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ—evaṁnāmā evaṅgottāti vāti …pe… dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vāti … amukasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā’ti?
mn79:10.9.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know her name or clan? Whether she’s tall or short or medium? Whether her skin is black, brown, or tawny? What village, town, or city she comes from?’

dn9:35.2.pli: ‘ahaṁ yā imasmiṁ janapade janapadakalyāṇī, taṁ icchāmi taṁ kāmemī’ti.
dn9:35.2.en: ‘Whoever the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land is, it is her that I want, her that I desire!’

dn9:35.4.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ khattiyī vā brāhmaṇī vā vessī vā suddī vā’ti?
dn9:35.4.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know whether she’s an aristocrat, a brahmin, a merchant, or a worker?’

dn9:35.7.pli: ‘ambho purisa, yaṁ tvaṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ icchasi kāmesi, jānāsi taṁ janapadakalyāṇiṁ evaṁnāmā evaṅgottāti vā, dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vāti, amukasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā’ti?
dn9:35.7.en: ‘Mister, that [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land who you desire—do you know her name or clan? Whether she’s tall or short or medium? Whether her skin is black, brown, or tawny? What village, town, or city she comes from?’

sn17.22:1.3.pli: na tassa, bhikkhave, janapadakalyāṇī ekā ekassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yassa lābhasakkārasiloko cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
sn17.22:1.3.en: Even if you’re alone with the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land she might not occupy your mind, but possessions, honor and popularity would still occupy your mind.

sn17.13-20:1.10.en: ‘… for the sake of the [38;5;121mfinest lady[0m in the land.’
